question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Bus and tram lane on left.
No parking inside the white line.
explanation: This sign tells you there is a tram lane on the left. Be aware that there might be pedestrians in the area and crossing the road.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of electric cables overhead. Drivers with a high load should be particularly careful.

question: Who can use a signed cycle track accompanied by a continuous white line on the left-hand side?
answers: Cyclists and users of motorised wheelchairs.
Drivers, when it is not being used by a cyclist.
Drivers when overtaking a vehicle turning right.
correctAnswer: Cyclists and users of motorised wheelchairs.
explanation: A cycle track is for the use of cyclists and motorised wheelchairs only. No other vehicles may cross into or over a mandatory cycle track unless this is necessary in order to leave or enter a side road or a property adjacent to the cycle track.

question: What lights indicate a zebra crossing?
explanation: A zebra crossing is indicated by amber flashing beacons on poles and black and white stripes on the road. You must stop for pedestrians on the crossing and for those about to cross.

question: What do temporary traffic lights at road works mean?
answers: A driver need not comply if a convoy of traffic is going in the same direction.
A driver need only comply when there is oncoming traffic.
A driver must comply with the lights at all times.
A driver must comply with the lights when workers are on site only.
correctAnswer: A driver must comply with the lights at all times.
explanation: You must comply with any temporary traffic lights used to control vehicle movements at or near road works. It is an offence not to obey these lights.

question: What do these signs together mean?
answers: Access for buses and taxis only during times shown.
Pedestrianised street ahead - traffic not allowed except during times shown.
Clearway ahead - no stopping or parking during times shown.
Parking not allowed during times shown.
correctAnswer: Pedestrianised street ahead - traffic not allowed except during times shown.
explanation: When posted together these signs tells you that there is a pedestrianised street ahead and that traffic is not allowed to enter except during the times stated on the information plate.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that you must not enter this area if your vehicle is over 3 tonnes or 3,000 kg.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Passing other traffic that exceeds the weight shown is not allowed.
Parking in loading area is not allowed.
Parking of vehicles under the weight shown is not allowed.
Parking of vehicles exceeding the weight shown is not allowed.
correctAnswer: Parking of vehicles exceeding the weight shown is not allowed.
explanation: This sign tells you that you must not park in this area if your vehicle is over the weight limit indicated.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that overtaking is prohibited. These signs are usually found in places where overtaking may be dangerous, such as in areas with reduced visibility.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Only buses, cyclists and taxis are allowed to use the lane outside the hours indicated.
Only buses, cyclists and taxis are allowed to use the lane ahead during the hours indicated.
Only buses and cyclists may park during the times indicated.
Only cyclists and buses are allowed to use the lane during the times indicated.
correctAnswer: Only buses, cyclists and taxis are allowed to use the lane ahead during the hours indicated.
explanation: This sign tells you there is a with-flow nearside bus lane ahead on the left – that is, one where the buses move in the same direction as the traffic to their right. The information plate tells the times when the bus lane is in operation. Only buses, taxis and cyclists may use the bus lane during those hours.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Only double-decker buses and cyclists may use lane.
Only buses and cyclists may park.
With-flow bus and cycle lane ahead on left.
Cyclists and buses must turn left.
correctAnswer: With-flow bus and cycle lane ahead on left.
explanation: This sign tells you there is a with-flow nearside bus lane ahead to the left. Only buses, taxis and cyclists may use the bus lane during the stated operational hours.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Bus and cycle lane ahead on right.
Buses must give way to cyclists ahead.
Cyclists must give way to buses ahead.
Buses must give way to other traffic ahead.
correctAnswer: Bus and cycle lane ahead on right.
explanation: This sign tells you that there is an offside bus lane ahead on the right. Only buses, taxis and cyclists may use the bus lane during the stated operational hours.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Buses may block the driver’s view of cyclists.
With-flow bus lane on the left.
With-flow bus lane on the right.
correctAnswer: With-flow bus lane on the right.
explanation: This sign indicates a with-flow offside bus lane on the right. Only buses, taxis and cyclists may use the bus lane during the stated operational hours.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Cycle track may be crossed by buses.
Contra-flow bus lane on the right.
correctAnswer: Contra-flow bus lane on the right.
explanation: This sign tells you that you must drive on the left and not use the contra-flow bus lane day or night. A contraflow bus lane is one where the buses are going in the opposite direction.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that you must drive on the left and not use the contra-flow bus lane day or night. A contra-flow bus lane is one where the buses are going in the opposite direction.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Parking only inside the white line.
explanation: This sign tells you there is an offside tram lane on the right. Drivers should also be aware that there might be pedestrians in the area.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Y-junction where main road bears to the left.
Y-junction where vehicles must go left.
Y-junction where main road bears to the right.
Y-junction where heavy vehicles must go left.
correctAnswer: Y-junction where main road bears to the left.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a Y-junction with a minor road ahead. The wider arm of the Y indicates the course of the main road.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Y-junction ahead with roads of equal importance.
correctAnswer: Y-junction ahead with roads of equal importance.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a Y-junction ahead with roads of equal importance. Approach such a junction with caution and be prepared to react to any changes in the traffic situation.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: T-junction ahead with roads of major importance.
Road passing under a bridge ahead.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a crossroads junction with a major road ahead. Be prepared to stop.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: T-junction ahead with a road of major importance.
Cul-de-sac to the left and right.
T-junction ahead with a road of minor importance.
correctAnswer: T-junction ahead with a road of major importance.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a T-junction ahead with a major road. Be prepared to yield or stop as necessary.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Level crossing ahead guarded by gates.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a crossroads junction at a dual carriageway ahead. Drivers need to be observant, taking extra care for traffic coming from each direction. Yield and/or stop as appropriate.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a T-junction at a dual carriageway ahead. Drivers need to be observant, taking extra care for traffic coming from each direction. Yield and/or stop as appropriate.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Traffic from the right has priority.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of traffic merging from the left. You should expect vehicles to join from the left. You may need to slow down, allowing them to merge safely.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of roads both merging (entering onto the main road) and diverging (exiting the main road). Drivers should be prepared for traffic changing speed and direction as vehicles enter or exit at the junctions on the left ahead.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a dangerous corner to the left. You may need to slow down and react to any changes in the traffic situation ahead.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Road closed - drivers must turn back.
Sharp change of direction to the left.
Sharp change of direction to the right.
correctAnswer: Sharp change of direction to the right.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a sharp change of direction to the right. You should slow down as you approach the hazard.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: The driver must overtake on the right only.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that the road narrows on the left ahead. You should show caution and prepare to adjust your road position.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Overtake only on the left ahead.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that the road divides ahead. You should prepare to move to the left.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a steep descent/downward slope ahead. You should react accordingly by adjusting speed and selecting the appropriate gear.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Restricted weight limit for road segment indicated.
Road narrows ahead - maximum length of vehicle is indicated.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that you are approaching a low bridge, with restricted headroom as shown on the sign.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Level crossing ahead unprotected by lights and barriers.
Level crossing ahead protected by lights and barriers.
correctAnswer: Level crossing ahead protected by lights and barriers.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a railway level crossing ahead protected by lights and barriers. The crossing may also have an audible warning alarm. You should be prepared to stop.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Road divides ahead - pass on the left or right.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a dip or depression in the road ahead which may be hidden and could obscure your view of oncoming traffic. You should reduce your speed accordingly and be aware that overtaking is dangerous in these areas.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Series of bumps or hollows ahead.
correctAnswer: Series of bumps or hollows ahead.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a series of bumps or hollows ahead. Be prepared to reduce your speed as necessary.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of the potential danger of slippery road surfaces ahead.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a traffic light controlled junction ahead. This sign is generally found in areas where the lights may not be visible to drivers in good time – for example, following a bend in the road.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a school ahead. You should adjust your speed and react accordingly as there may be children in the area.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that there may be crosswinds ahead. Crosswinds can affect the stability of your vehicle on the road. Be prepared to slow down if necessary.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This is a motorway information sign that tells you that the motorway will end in 500 metres ahead. Motorway rules will no longer apply, for example a lower speed limit may be applicable.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign indicates the end of the motorway. You are leaving the motorway and its rules will no longer apply.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Right-hand lane has an uneven surface.
A driver may overtake on the left only.
explanation: Where there are roadworks up ahead, this warning sign tells you that the road narrows from the right creating a potential hazard.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that the road narrows on both sides creating a potential hazard. Be prepared to slow down and drive with extra care.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that the traffic flow ahead is controlled manually by a flagman. Be aware and follow directions given by the flagman.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This warning sign tells you that during roadworks there will be two-way traffic in operation ahead. Continue to drive with extra care.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Traffic in nearside lane must turn left.
T-junction ahead in the left lane.
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that the nearside (left-hand) lane is closed ahead. If you are in this lane you will need to move to the offside (right-hand) lane when it is safe to do so.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: No stopping, except in offside lane.
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that the offside (right-hand) lane of three is closed ahead. Drivers in the nearside or centre lanes should be aware that traffic may merge from the right.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Slow lane ahead for heavy traffic.
Bend in the road to the left ahead.
Traffic should cross back to the left-hand lane ahead.
correctAnswer: Traffic should cross back to the left-hand lane ahead.
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that the course of the road will return to the left ahead. This usually appears after a stretch where traffic was diverted to a right-hand lane.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Traffic should cross out to the right-hand lane ahead.
Bend in the road to the right ahead.
correctAnswer: Traffic should cross out to the right-hand lane ahead.
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that the course of the road will divert to the right ahead.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Beware of vehicle with a wide load.
End of central reserve or obstruction.
correctAnswer: End of central reserve or obstruction.
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that traffic previously separated by the central reserve or an obstruction will revert to two-way traffic.

question: What does this hand signal mean?
answers: The cyclist intends to move out or turn right.
The cyclist intends to slow down.
The cyclist intends to move in or turn left.
correctAnswer: The cyclist intends to move out or turn right.
explanation: This hand signal tells other road users that the cyclist intends to either move out or make a right-hand turn. Drivers should be aware that cyclists could move out into the path of their vehicle without looking.

question: What does this hand signal mean?
answers: The cyclist is signalling following traffic to overtake.
The cyclist intends to turn left.
The cyclist intends to move out.
The cyclist intends to slow down or stop.
correctAnswer: The cyclist intends to slow down or stop.
explanation: This hand signal informs other road users that cyclist intends to slow down or stop. This may indicate that the cyclist is aware of some hazard ahead, so drive with extra care.

question: What does this hand signal mean?
answers: The driver intends to slow down or stop.
The driver intends to turn left.
The driver intends to proceed straight ahead.
correctAnswer: The driver intends to proceed straight ahead.
explanation: This hand signal informs other road users or a Garda directing traffic that the driver intends to proceed straight ahead.

question: What does this traffic light mean?
answers: Traffic turning left may proceed if the way is clear.
Traffic turning left should prepare for full green to move off.
All traffic must turn left only.
Traffic is not allowed to turn left.
correctAnswer: Traffic turning left may proceed if the way is clear.
explanation: A green arrow (filter light) means that traffic may proceed in the direction of the arrow if it is safe to do so.

question: When traffic lights are green, when should a driver not proceed?
answers: When oncoming traffic is waiting to turn left.
When traffic is stopped waiting to turn from the road on the left.
When it would be unsafe to do so.
When traffic is stopped waiting to turn from the road on the right.
correctAnswer: When it would be unsafe to do so.
explanation: Although a green traffic light means proceed with caution, you should not enter a junction if the way is not clear or if by doing so you would cause an obstruction to other road users.

question: Where is a driver allowed to park?
answers: Where there is a continuous white line along the centre of the road.
Where the driver is not blocking other road users their view of traffic signals or the road ahead.
correctAnswer: Where the driver is not blocking other road users their view of traffic signals or the road ahead.
explanation: It is an offence to park at the side of a road that has a single or double continuous white line along its centre. Parking on such a road could create an obstruction and may cause inconvenience or danger to other road users.

question: What distance before a zebra crossing is parking prohibited?
explanation: It is an offence to park 15 metres before or 5 metres after a pedestrian crossing. Parking in this manner may restrict the zone of vision of drivers approaching the crossing and endanger pedestrians.

question: Within what distance of a road junction is parking prohibited?
answers: 20 metres, unless parking spaces are clearly marked.
10 metres, unless parking spaces are clearly marked.
5 metres, unless parking spaces are clearly marked.
15 metres, unless parking spaces are clearly marked.
correctAnswer: 5 metres, unless parking spaces are clearly marked.
explanation: It is an offence to park within 5 metres of a road junction unless parking spaces are clearly marked. Parking in that area may restrict the zone of vision of drivers approaching the junction and may cause an obstruction to large vehicles wishing to turn.

question: Is a driver permitted to park at an entrance to a property?
answers: Yes, for 1 hour between 23:30 hrs to 07:00 hrs.
Yes, for 1 hour between 07:00 hrs to 23:30 hrs.
Yes, with the property owner’s consent.
correctAnswer: Yes, with the property owner’s consent.
explanation: You may park across the entrance to a property only with the owner’s consent. Parking across an entrance may cause inconvenience and danger to persons entering or leaving the property.

question: When is parking permitted on a footpath?
answers: When cars are parked on both sides of the road.
When at least half of the footpath remains free for pedestrians.
When no more than half of the vehicle is on the footpath.
It is never permitted to park on a footpath.
correctAnswer: It is never permitted to park on a footpath.
explanation: It is an offence to park on a footpath. Where a vehicle is parked on a footpath, pedestrians may have to step onto the road to go around the vehicle and so place themselves in danger.

question: When is double parking permitted?
answers: When there are double yellow lines.
When there is a hard shoulder.
When there are double white lines.
explanation: Double parking is never permitted. Parking is never permitted where it might interfere in any way with the normal flow of traffic or obstruct or endanger other road users.

question: When is parking permitted at a taxi rank?
answers: When waiting to collect passengers from a taxi.
Parking at a taxi rank is prohibited unless driving a taxi.
When parking for less than 15 minutes.
correctAnswer: Parking at a taxi rank is prohibited unless driving a taxi.
explanation: Stopping or parking within an area marked as a taxi rank is prohibited as this may obstruct taxis entering or leaving the rank.

question: When is parking permitted at a sharp bend?
answers: Parking is never permitted at a sharp bend.
When the hazard warning lights of the parked vehicle are on.
When drivers coming from behind can see the parked vehicle.
When parking no more than 45 centimetres from the kerb or edge of the road.
correctAnswer: Parking is never permitted at a sharp bend.
explanation: Parking is never permitted where it might interfere in any way with the normal flow of traffic or obstruct or endanger other road users – for example, by forcing other drivers into the path of oncoming traffic.

question: When is parking permitted on the brow of a hill?
answers: When the driver angles the wheels towards the kerb.
Parking is permitted when a vehicle has an efficient handbrake.
Parking is never permitted on the brow of a hill.
Only when there is no traffic on the road.
correctAnswer: Parking is never permitted on the brow of a hill.
explanation: Parking on the brow of a hill or on a humpbacked bridge is prohibited. Parking in such a place may restrict the zone of vision of drivers approaching the hill and force them into the path of oncoming traffic.

question: What is the purpose of traffic calming measures?
answers: To slow down traffic in the vicinity.
To inform the driver of an increased speed limit ahead.
To alert drivers to road flooding ahead.
correctAnswer: To slow down traffic in the vicinity.
explanation: The purpose of traffic calming measures is to slow down fast-moving traffic to a speed more suitable for the area they are entering. These measures are usually found in rural areas on the entry points to towns or villages.

question: When may a trailer be towed on a public road without a rear number plate?
answers: When being towed by an agricultural tractor.
When carrying a load that overhangs the trailer.
Never, a number plate must always be displayed.
correctAnswer: Never, a number plate must always be displayed.
explanation: The law requires all motorised vehicles to display a rear number plate that is clean and legible.

question: What traffic may use a cycle lane accompanied by a continuous white line?
explanation: A cycle track is for the use of cyclists and motorised wheelchairs. No other vehicles may cross into or over a mandatory cycle track unless this is necessary in order to leave a side road or a property adjacent to the cycle track.

question: Apart from cyclists and motorised wheelchairs, what other road users may use an unoccupied cycle lane accompanied by a broken white line?
answers: All drivers may make temporary use.
correctAnswer: All drivers may make temporary use.
explanation: Drivers may make temporary use of a cycle track with a broken white line on the right-hand side if it is not occupied.

question: When must drivers stop at an automated railway level crossing with barriers and red flashing lights?
answers: When there are no lights visible.
When the red and amber lights stop flashing.
When the barrier is fully up.
Stop safely when the amber light shows, or when red lights start to flash.
correctAnswer: Stop safely when the amber light shows, or when red lights start to flash.
explanation: You must stop safely when the amber light shows. Flashing red lights have the same meaning as a steady red traffic light - stop safely when they show.

question: At a railway level crossing with unattended gates, what should a car driver do?
answers: Open both gates and after passing the first, stop and close it.
Telephone the nearest railway station before opening a gate.
Drive halfway across and close the first gate before opening the second.
Open both gates before proceeding to cross.
correctAnswer: Open both gates before proceeding to cross.
explanation: At a level crossing with unattended gates a driver must stop, look for trains and listen for the sound of a horn or approaching trains. If it is safe, open both gates, complete the crossing and then close both gates.

question: What do flashing amber arrows indicate at a junction?
answers: When safe, drivers should proceed in the direction indicated.
It is prohibited to proceed in the direction indicated.
The direction indicated is a cul-de-sac.
Proceed smartly through junction to avoid delay.
correctAnswer: When safe, drivers should proceed in the direction indicated.
explanation: When you meet a flashing amber arrow at a junction, you should proceed in the direction indicated provided it is safe to do so.

question: When do temporary speed limits apply at roadworks?
answers: Only when there is oncoming traffic.
For the duration of the roadworks.
Only when road workers are on site.
correctAnswer: For the duration of the roadworks.
explanation: Temporary speed limits at road works apply for the duration of the works. When road works are completed, normal speed limits apply.

question: What does a continuous white line along the centre of the road mean?
explanation: You must never do a U-turn on any stretch of road with a continuous white line along its centre. The restricted vision at such places would make doing a U-turn very unsafe.

question: When wanting to stop temporarily in a congested area where should the driver park?
answers: Park slightly up on the footpath with the hazard lights on.
Double park in a convenient place with your hazard lights on.
Park in a safe, legal and convenient place.
Park on the footpath so as not to impede the free flow of traffic in the road.
correctAnswer: Park in a safe, legal and convenient place.
explanation: You should park only where it is safe, legal and convenient to do so. Your parked vehicle must not cause a danger or an obstruction to other road users. The use of hazard warning lights does not excuse unsafe or illegal parking.

question: What is a clearway?
answers: An area that is reserved for pedestrians and motorised wheelchairs.
An area that is strictly reserved for the loading and unloading of HGVs.
An area where stopping and parking is not permitted during certain times.
An area where stopping and parking is reserved for buses and taxis only.
correctAnswer: An area where stopping and parking is not permitted during certain times.
explanation: A clearway is an area of road that must be kept clear for moving traffic during certain times of the day (usually busy periods). The times when stopping or parking is prohibited are shown on an information plate under the sign.

question: What does this sign mean when displayed on the approach to a toll plaza?
explanation: This sign is used at toll plazas to direct traffic into a lane where the toll charge may be paid directly to a cashier. This lane would normally be used by motorists who have neither the exact change nor an electronic tag on their vehicle.

question: What does this sign mean when displayed on the approach to a toll plaza?
explanation: This sign is used at toll plazas to direct traffic into a lane where the toll charge may be paid by putting the exact change into an automatic coin machine. This lane usually has a height barrier fitted to prevent large vehicles using it.

question: What does this sign mean when displayed on the approach to a toll plaza?
answers: Electronic toll not accepted in this lane.
Payment in euros only in this lane.
Electronic toll accepted in any lane.
Electronic toll out of order in this lane.
correctAnswer: Electronic toll accepted in any lane.
explanation: This sign is used at toll plazas to direct traffic into a lane where the toll charge is collected electronically. When the vehicle passes through the plaza it is identified by means of an electronic tag fitted to the front windscreen. Payment will be collected via the users account. Only vehicles fitted with the tags are allowed to use those lanes.

question: What does a flashing amber arrow pointing left at a traffic light mean?
answers: The driver must wait until the traffic lights turn green.
A driver may proceed before traffic on the other road.
A driver must not proceed in this direction.
A driver may turn left but must yield to traffic on the other road.
correctAnswer: A driver may turn left but must yield to traffic on the other road.
explanation: A flashing left amber arrow at a junction means you may proceed left but must give way to pedestrians and traffic already coming through the junction on the other road.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This road sign informs road users that they are entering the motorway and must obey motorway rules. Before driving on the motorway users must familiarise themselves with motorway rules.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Y-junction ahead with roads of equal importance.
correctAnswer: Y-junction ahead with roads of equal importance.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a Y-junction hazard ahead with a road of equal importance. Be prepared to yield to other road users.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a roundabout ahead. You must be prepared to yield to other road users already on the roundabout or coming from the right.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a mini-roundabout ahead. You must be prepared to yield to other road users already on the roundabout or coming from the right.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of an automatic level crossing ahead. Drivers should approach with caution and be prepared to slow down or stop as necessary.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Unprotected quay, canal or river ahead.
correctAnswer: Unprotected quay, canal or river ahead.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of an unprotected area of water ahead. You should be cautious due to the extreme danger.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that there may be deer or other wild animals coming onto the roadway. Be prepared to slow down or stop suddenly if required.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This warning sign tells you that there are roadworks ahead. You should approach with caution and be alert for a change in the road surface, and for the presence of machinery and road workers.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Cycle track ahead may be crossed by buses only.
Parking for buses and bicycles on left.
With-flow bus and cycle lane on left.
Parking for bicycles only on right.
correctAnswer: With-flow bus and cycle lane on left.
explanation: This sign indicates a nearside with-flow bus lane on the left. Only buses, taxis and cyclists may use the bus lane during the stated operational hours.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Crossroads ahead with roads of lesser importance.
Crossroads ahead with roads of equal importance.
correctAnswer: Crossroads ahead with roads of equal importance.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a crossroad junction ahead where the roads are of equal importance. At this type of junction you should yield to traffic approaching from the right and traffic already turning.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a dangerous bend to the left. You may need to slow down and react to any changes in the traffic situation ahead.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a series of dangerous corners ahead. You should slow down and react to any changes in the traffic situation.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a series of dangerous bends ahead. You should slow down and react to any changes in the traffic situation.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign indicates that the road narrows on both sides, meaning drivers should be prepared for a change in the road width, and they may need to adjust their speed or position accordingly. It's important to pay attention to this sign to ensure safe driving in narrow sections of the road.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of two-way traffic ahead, with oncoming traffic in the opposite lane.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a steep ascent/upward hill ahead. You should react by selecting the appropriate gear.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Level crossing ahead with pedestrian walkway.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that there may be school children crossing the road ahead, slow down if required and be prepared to stop.

question: What do these signs together mean?
answers: Loose chippings on the road ahead.
explanation: These signs are usually displayed in residential areas, and they give advance warning that children might be crossing ahead. You should proceed cautiously and be prepared to stop suddenly.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Possibility of cattle or farm animals ahead.
correctAnswer: Possibility of cattle or farm animals ahead.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that there may be cattle or other farm animals on the road ahead. Slow down if required and be prepared to stop.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that there may be sheep on the road ahead. Slow down if required and be prepared to stop.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a tunnel ahead. You should be aware of the procedures to follow when entering a tunnel – which include keeping a safe distance from the vehicle ahead or removing sunglasses.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that there is a danger of rocks and other debris falling onto the road. Drive with caution.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that there may be low-flying aircraft in the area. Low-flying aircraft can cause distraction due to a sudden loud noise.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: A driver must overtake on the left-hand side.
A driver must merge from the left.
A driver must drive on the left-hand side.

question: When can the holder of a Category W learner permit carry a passenger?

Only when the passenger also holds a Category W driving licence and the vehicle is designed to carry a passenger.
Only when the passenger holds a Category AM driving licence.
Only when the passenger holds a Category AM driving licence and the vehicle is designed to carry a passenger.
correctAnswer: Only when the passenger also holds a Category W driving licence and the vehicle is designed to carry a passenger.
explanation: The holder of a Category W learner permit may carry a passenger in the vehicle only if: The vehicle is designed to take a passenger, and the passenger has held a full driving licence in Category W for two or more years.

question: Is a driver allowed to use rebated (green) diesel fuel in a car on a public road?
answers: Green diesel may be used in a car only in winter months.
Green diesel may never be used in a car.
Green diesel may be used in a car only in summer months.
Green diesel may be used in a car only if the car is a taxis.
correctAnswer: Green diesel may never be used in a car.
explanation: If, in its normal use, a vehicle is used on a public road, it must use unmarked (white) diesel, as the appropriate excise duties are included in the purchase price. Drivers can be prosecuted for using green diesel in a vehicle on a public road.

question: When must a tractor or works vehicle be fitted with a rear-view mirror?
answers: A rear-view mirror must always be fitted.
A rear-view mirror must be fitted only when towing a trailer.
A rear-view mirror is not required in a tractor or works vehicle.
A rear-view mirror must be fitted only when towing a trailer over 8 metres long.
correctAnswer: A rear-view mirror must always be fitted.
explanation: All vehicles used on a public road must have a rear-view mirror. The mirror should be used to enable the driver to see the traffic and road conditions behind and to each side.

question: What is the maximum gross weight of a vehicle that may be driven by the holder of a Category B driving licence?
explanation: The holder of a Category B driving licence is not permitted to drive a vehicle with a design gross vehicle weight of more than 3,500 kg. This restriction is noted on the licence.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: The driver must stop their vehicle.
The driver must give way to traffic coming from the right.
The driver must stop for school crossing ahead.
The driver must proceed if the way is clear.
correctAnswer: The driver must stop their vehicle.
explanation: This sign appears at junctions where a minor road joins a major road. You must stop your vehicle completely at a STOP sign.

question: What must a driver do when this sign is accompanied by a white stop line on the road?
answers: Stop at the line only if you see traffic approaching.
Stop only if no traffic light is present.
explanation: When accompanied by a STOP sign, the white stop line indicates the point at which you must stop your vehicle.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that you must not proceed in the direction of the arrow. This is displayed to prevent traffic going in the wrong direction – for example, the wrong way up a one-way street.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Dangerous bend to the right ahead.
explanation: This sign is displayed at a junction where you must not turn right.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Speed should be reduced to 30 km/h temporarily.
explanation: This sign tells you that the maximum legal speed limit permitted for this section of road is 30 km/h. These signs are commonly found in slow zones in residential areas.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that the maximum legal speed limit permitted for this section of road is 50 km/h.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Speed applies only during daytime hours.
explanation: This sign tells you that the maximum legal speed limit permitted for this section of road is 60 km/h.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that the maximum legal speed limit permitted for this section of road is 80 km/h.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that the maximum legal speed limit permitted for this section of road is 100 km/h.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Public and private vehicles parking allowed.
explanation: This sign tells you that parking is prohibited in both directions.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: The driver must stop when red lights show.
Stop and wait for amber light before proceeding.
Stop and wait for green light before proceeding.
Proceed if the way is clear.
correctAnswer: The driver must stop when red lights show.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning that you must stop when red lights show. This sign may be displayed at a railway level crossing.

question: What does this hand signal mean?
answers: The cyclist intends to turn left.
The cyclist intends to turn right.
The cyclist intends to overtake another vehicle.
correctAnswer: The cyclist intends to turn left.
explanation: This hand signal informs other road users that the cyclist intends to make a left-hand turn.

question: What does this traffic light mean?
answers: The driver must divert to the right.
The driver must stop and wait until the full green light appears.
The driver may proceed in the direction of the green arrow if the way is clear.
The driver must stop and wait for the red light to turn green.
correctAnswer: The driver may proceed in the direction of the green arrow if the way is clear.
explanation: A green arrow (filter light) means that traffic may proceed in the direction of the arrow if it is safe to do so.

question: What does this traffic light mean?
answers: Traffic may stop if safe to do so.
Traffic must stop at the traffic light.
Traffic must proceed if safe to do so.
Traffic must stop if the light is amber.
correctAnswer: Traffic must stop at the traffic light.
explanation: A red light means STOP. You must not go beyond the stop line or (if there is no stop line) beyond the light.

question: What road users must comply with traffic lights (including pedestrian lights)?
explanation: All road users including pedestrians must comply with traffic controls. Drivers should be aware that traffic lights and pedestrian lights can be combined at junctions and should show caution and consideration to pedestrians.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that the road ahead has been resurfaced and there may be loose chippings. You should reduce speed while driving through this area as the loose chippings could affect your vehicle’s road holding and braking.

question: When must the holder of a learner permit display L plates on their car?
answers: When driving on their first learner permit.
When driving unaccompanied by a full licence holder.
Only when driving outside urban areas.
explanation: The holder of a learner permit must display L plates on the front and rear of their car at all times when driving on public roads.

question: When can a child under the age of sixteen drive a tractor on a public road?
answers: A child under 16 is allowed to drive a tractor on a public road when accompanied by a fully licensed driver.
Children under 16 are not allowed to drive a tractor on a public road.
A child under 16 is allowed to drive a tractor on a public road when they hold a learner permit.
A child under 16 may drive a tractor without any restrictions if supervised by a parent.
correctAnswer: Children under 16 are not allowed to drive a tractor on a public road.
explanation: Persons under 16 years of age are not permitted to drive a tractor in a public place.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that you must keep left. It is usually displayed at a traffic island in the centre of the road and also used on occasion to control traffic at roadworks.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that you must keep right. It is usually found in a one-way system where the traffic is required to keep to the right and also used on occasion to control traffic at roadworks.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign is displayed at a junction where you may not turn right.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign is displayed at a junction where you may not turn left.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that the maximum legal speed limit permitted for this section of road is 120 km/h.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Parking prohibited at the times shown.
Maximum parking for one hour during times shown.
Parking permitted during the times shown.
correctAnswer: Parking permitted during the times shown.
explanation: These signs tell you that parking is permitted in both directions, but only at the times shown on the information plate.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Road closed during the times shown.
Clearway - no stopping or parking during the times shown.
Pedestrianised street - no access for vehicles.
Parking permitted during the times shown.
correctAnswer: Clearway - no stopping or parking during the times shown.
explanation: A clearway sign means that stopping or parking is not permitted in this area during the times shown on the information plate.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Staggered crossroads ahead with roads of equal importance.
Cul-de-sac to both left and right.
Roads closed ahead to both left and right.
correctAnswer: Staggered crossroads ahead with roads of equal importance.
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of a staggered junction ahead with roads to the left and right. Be aware that vehicles may be emerging from these roads.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign gives advance warning of the end of a dual carriageway. You will soon be entering a 2-way road.

question: What does this sign mean?
answers: Three hundred meters to the next exit.
Next junction is two hundred meters ahead.
correctAnswer: Three hundred meters to the next exit.
explanation: This is a motorway information sign that tells you that the next exit off the motorway is 300 metres ahead.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This is a motorway information sign that tells you that the next exit off the motorway is 100 metres ahead.

question: What does this hand signal mean?
answers: The cyclist intends to cross the road.
The cyclist intends to turn left.
The cyclist intends to speed up.
correctAnswer: The cyclist intends to turn left.
explanation: This hand signal informs other road users that the cyclist intends to turn left.

question: What does this Garda signal mean?
answers: Proceed if approaching from the front.
Stop if approaching from the front.
correctAnswer: Stop if approaching from the front.
explanation: When approaching a Garda giving this signal you must stop.

question: What does this road marking indicate?
explanation: A zebra crossing is a designated area for pedestrians to cross the road. As a driver you must always yield to pedestrians on a zebra crossing.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for cars and motorcycles on motorways?
explanation: It is illegal to exceed 120 km/h when driving on a motorway.

question: Unless otherwise indicated, what is the maximum speed allowed for a car towing a caravan on a motorway?
explanation: When towing a caravan on a motorway it is illegal to exceed 80 km/h – excessive speed will make such a vehicle unstable.

question: Unless otherwise indicated, what is the maximum speed allowed for a car towing a trailer on a motorway?
explanation: When towing a trailer on a motorway it is illegal to exceed 80 km/h – excessive speed will make such a vehicle unstable.

question: Who is authorized to see a driver’s vehicle registration document?
answers: Any person with whom the driver is involved in a collision.
Any Fire Brigade or Ambulance personnel at the scene of a collision the driver has been involved in.
A member of the car recovery company or anyone assisting in the recovery.
A Garda may ask you to produce the vehicle’s registration document at a named Garda station.
correctAnswer: A Garda may ask you to produce the vehicle’s registration document at a named Garda station.
explanation: A Garda may demand to see your driving licence at any time, and you should always carry this with you when driving. A Garda may also examine your insurance disc, tax disc and NCT disc (if applicable). A Garda may ask you to produce other documents (including the vehicle’s registration document) at a named Garda station within 10 days.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This sign tells you that you must proceed straight ahead. This sign is usually displayed on the entry to a one-way street.

question: Unless otherwise indicated, what is the maximum speed allowed for cars or motorcycles on national roads?
explanation: It is illegal to exceed 100 km/h when driving on a single carriageway national road.

question: Unless otherwise indicated, what is the maximum speed allowed for a car towing a caravan on national roads?
explanation: When towing a caravan on a national road, it is illegal to exceed 80 km/h – excessive speed will make such a vehicle unstable.

question: Unless otherwise indicated, what is the maximum speed allowed for a car towing a trailer on national roads?
explanation: When towing a trailer on a national road, it is illegal to exceed 80 km/h – exceeding this speed will make the vehicle unstable.

question: What does this sign mean?
explanation: This roadworks warning sign tells you that the surface ahead is uneven and you should approach with caution.
